Even the mighty needed a respite, and Megatron X was no different. He had=
 watched over the spark and the slow manufacture of it's new body. He had n=
ot gone far, now standing still in an alcove in a dark lightly room. Cables=
, hoses, and clamps held him in place, replacing coolant in his systems, re=
plenishing his energon and refueling his weapons. It was cold, his form now=
 could as ice with a low fog hangin over his form. 
=A0
It was after the st=
anger left that he notified. Still physically immobilized, his consciousnes=
s came online and accessed the base's internal and external security networ=
k. Scans indicated the spark had competed it's body, and now had left. Odd,=
 he not think it would be able to do so. Perhaps it knew his security codes=
, or simply broke out. Switching to external sensors, he scanned all of the=
 island of Hokkaido for signs of his guest.
--- On Sat, 8/8/09, Lady Barbos=
sa <MaximaSR74@...> wrote:


From: Lady Barbossa <MaximaSR74@...>
S=
ubject: Re: Returning Home
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday, Augus=
t 8, 2009, 12:52 AM


=A0 



> > =A0
> > "Arise, stand strong again, warri=
or. Heed the call of Megatron."
> > 
> 
> What sounded like whispers for bu=
t a moment, broke away to silence. Then a ghostly reverse echo that whisper=
ed and barely heard. Soon enough was well heard. 
> 
> "Megatron?" the femm=
e voice replied almost in disbelief. 
> The spark pulsed a moment as though=
 it were contemplating or something else. But definitely feeding off the en=
ergon. 
> "I am most grateful for the energon and the rescue." That calm de=
ep femme voice stated. "And honored to once again be in thy presense, oh, m=
ighty Megatron." Her voice sincere to every degree. There was only one whom=
 she respected 100%... and that was Megatron. 
> "I am forever in your debt=
." 
> 
> The spark hummed with light, brilliant and glowing, sparks of cont=
rolled energy in gold and blue. Glowing like a star in the heavens.
>

Sile=
nce overtook the vicinity once more. Darkness and silence. Not that it was =
a bad thing... but it wasn't a good thing either. 
The spark pulsed from ti=
me to time, feeding off the energy that was offered to it, recovering. 
It =
had recovered enough strength for the time being. Some sparks recalled past=
 memories. It took some time, but this particular spark was able to recall =
much. The last moments it was functioning or alive was as some predacon to =
assasinate someone. And a name, a face, a sensation seemed to reverberate c=
ausing the spark to pulse.

Nearby the spark, a chassis was being construct=
ed. A large one. One nearly the height of the original Megatron. As drone p=
arts worked furiously upon the chassis, the spark pulsed moreso. The contai=
nment that held it, nurtured it, opened and out floated the spark. 

Like a=
 ghost, it wandered about before leaving the facility. For the time being, =
the spark had forgotten about it's rescuer. But it would return. Soon or ev=
entually.
